definitions.definition: in, into, or towards a previous place or condition, or an earlier time:
examples: When you take the scissors, remember to put them back.
If he hits me, I'll hit him back.
I'm busy at the moment - can I call you back?

definitions.definition: the inside or outside part of an object, vehicle, building, etc. that is furthest from the front:
examples: He jotted her name down on the back of an envelope.

definitions.definition: close together and facing in opposite directions:
examples: The office was full of computers, and we had to sit back to back in long rows.

definitions.definition: happening one after another, without interruption:
examples: Coming up after the break, three Rolling Stones classics back to back.

definitions.definition: with the back part of something where the front should be:
examples: You've put your jumper on back to front.

definitions.definition: the side of your hand that has hair growing on it
to give support to someone or something with money or words:
examples: The management has refused to back our proposals.

definitions.definition: at or near the back of something:
examples: She left the house by the back door.
